data.title: Chetan Hansraj
data.text:
Indian television actor (born 1972)

Chetan Hansraj (born 15 June 1972) is an Indian film and television actor.[2]

Career

[edit]

Hansraj started his career as a child actor in 1980, doing over 250 press advertisements and 30 ad films, and his debut film Kook Doo Koo was selected for the children's films festival in France in 1984. He made his television debut with a role as young Balram in "Mahabharat" by B.R. Chopra.

Kkusum[3] as Garv. Later, he played in Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii as Sasha, Virrudh as Rudraksh and Dharti Ka Veer Yodha Prithviraj Chauhan as Raja Bhimdev.[4] He also appeared in the music video of Shweta Shetty's pop album song 'Deewane to Deewane hai', with Kushal Punjabi and Akashdeep Saigal, which was released in 1997. He also appeared in reality shows like Fear Factor India and Iss Jungle Se Mujhe Bachao.[5]

Personal life

[edit]

Hansraj married Lavania Pereira on 12 December 2004 and the couple has a son named Ethan Hansraj who was born on 2 February 2006.[1][6]
